I've heard that you can spread oil on the rough side of those "privacy" windows and it lets you see through them, basically because the roughness of the textured glass scatters the light in all directions and prevents you seeing through. But spreading an oil on top evens it out and allows the light to pass through in one direction allowing you to see through. Not recommended for dodgy reasons, of course.
